p: Fresh samples of vegetative aerial parts were collected, in triplicate, from B. microdonta, B. pauciflosculosa, B. punctulata, B. reticularioides, and B. sphenophylla in March 2016 from open and sunny habitats in Campos Gerais, Ponta Grossa, Paraná, Southern Brazil (coordinates 25°5′11′′ S and 50°6′23′′ W). The specimens were registered as ECT0000644 ( B. microdonta), ECT0000641 ( B. pauciflosculosa), ECT0000645 ( B. punctulata), ECT0000642 ( B. reticularioides), and ECT0000647 ( B. sphenophylla), and deposited in the Herbarium of Embrapa Clima Temperado (ECT) in Rio Grande do Sul, Brazil. The access to the botanical material was authorized and licensed by the Conselho de Gestão do Patrimônio Genético (CGEN/SISGEN) registered under number A429DA6. The collected plant materials were selected and standardized in order to obtain leaves and stems with the same pattern. Then, the materials were dried in the shade at room temperature and cut into small pieces (~1 cm).
